Author: c2k#4915
Content:
@Caglio not sure if you follow stocks but high yielding stocks are not "growth" stocks. people buy them for the dividend. if you think of KMD in terms of a dividend paying stock, and not a "growth"  company, you can adjust your expectations. I.E. slow steady price up/down/sideways with relatively low volatility, not explosive at all...and all you care about it the dividends - or in this case the rewards.

If you want a growth company this isnt likely it for you.
